text: Question 7. (6 points) Consider performing regression on a data set with d = 1. Match the models below to the plots showing the learned regression curves by writing the corresponding Roman numeral (i,i,iii,iv,v,vi) next to each model name. Each numeral should be used exactly once. (a) OLS (b) L2-regularized linear regression (a.k.a. Ridge regression) (c) L2-regularized RBF kernel regression with larger o (larger “width”) (d) L2-regularized RBF kernel regression with smaller o (smaller “width”) (e) L2-regularized polynomial basis regression with p = 20 (f) KNN regression with k = 3 (predicts the average y-value of the 3 nearest points) 4 : 4 : > 4 . 2 W . i Y 0 v 0 ot =2 0 2 -2 0 2 i it 4 0 10 2 W . 5 .
